meanings.definition: To set or place apart; detach or separate so as to be alone.
meanings.sent1: She isolates herself in her room when she wants to be alone.
meanings.sent2: The scientist isolates the bacteria in a separate petri dish for study.
meanings.sent3: The cat isolates the toy mouse from the rest of its toys.
meanings.sent4: His fear isolates him from forming close relationships with others.
meanings.sent5: The island isolates the small village from the mainland, creating a sense of seclusion.

meanings.sent1: The teacher isolates the noisy student from the rest of the class.
meanings.sent2: During the pandemic, it is important to isolate sick individuals to prevent the spread of illness.
meanings.sent3: The babysitter isolates the mischievous toddler in a playpen to keep him out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: The security guard isolates the troublemaker from entering the building.
meanings.sent5: The lifeguard isolates the swimmer who is not following the pool rules to ensure safety for everyone.

meanings.sent3: The abandoned teddy bear in the toy box is an isolates waiting for a new owner.
meanings.sent4: The rare flower in the garden is an isolates that stands out among the rest.
meanings.sent5: The broken toy on the shelf is an isolates that no longer fits in with the others.
